messages.title: For the many - not the few

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Improving Health and Care Support for Older People
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Stephen Burke is actively working in North Norfolk to improve health, care, and support for older people.

mentions.candidate: Stephen Burke is actively working in North Norfolk - improving, health, care and support for older people in North Norfolk. He is on the governing body of the NHS in North Norfolk and on the board of Victory Housing Trust, Age UK Norfolk, North Norfolk Community Transport and Norfolk Family Mediation Service.

issues.health: Stephen Burke is actively working in North Norfolk to improve health, care, and support for older people. He is on the governing body of the NHS in North Norfolk.
issues.socialWelfare: Stephen Burke is on the board of Victory Housing Trust, Age UK Norfolk, North Norfolk Community Transport, and Norfolk Family Mediation Service.

community.content: Stephen Burke enjoys walking his dogs on the beach, running and swimming at Happisburgh.

leaflet.personalStatement: Stephen is dedicated to making North Norfolk a great place to live and work for all generations.

politicalExperience.role: Vice-chair of the Friends of Happisburgh Lighthouse
politicalExperience.achievements: Stephen does the PR for the lighthouse.
Stephen has been chief executive of two national care charities and now runs the Good Care Guide and the think tank United for All Ages.

images.caption: Stephen Burke, Labour's candidate for North Norfolk, Thursday 8 June
